# Company Slogan/Motto: "The Heart of Every Subaru."
Company Profile:
Rush Performance Subaru is the dedicated specialist for every Subaru owner, enthusiast, and racer. We live and breathe the Subaru brand, providing an unmatched one-stop hub for sales, service, parts, and performance.

About Us: 
We are not just a garage or a parts dealer; we are Subaru specialists. Founded by passionate experts, our business is built on deep technical knowledge of the Subaru Boxer engine and drivetrain. From the classic GC8 to the latest WRX and Outback, we understand the soul of your car.

Our Mission: 
To keep every Subaru on the road and performing at its peak by providing unparalleled access to quality parts, expert services, and honest advice to the global Subaru community.

Our Vision: 
To be recognized as the leading global destination for Subaru performance, reliability, and community.

---------------------------------------
# Core Services & Products
- Engine Bay: Brand new and low-mileage used Subaru engines (EJ & FA series). Engine builds and swaps.
- Parts Specialists: Genuine, OEM, and quality aftermarket spare parts. Specializing in turbo, drivetrain, and suspension components.
- Body & Break: Full car breaking for parts. Quality used body panels, interiors, and trim.
- Car Trading: We buy and sell runner and non-runner Subaru vehicles for project, repair, or restoration.
- Expert Garage: Diagnostic, maintenance, repair, and performance tuning by certified Subaru technicians.
- Services (Use as "Services" section or keywords):
- Subaru Engine Sales (New & Used)
- Subaru Performance Parts
- OEM Subaru Spare Parts
- Subaru Car Breaking for Parts
- Used Subaru Body Panels
- Subaru Vehicle Buying & Selling
- Subaru Specialist Garage
- Subaru Diagnostic & Repair
- Subaru Engine Swap Service
- Subaru Performance Tuning
- Engine Sales: New & Used Engines, Rebuilt/Reconditioned Engines, Engine Core Components. Used EJ & FA series engines (with mileage & warranty). New OEM or performance crate engines. Rebuilt heads, short/long blocks. Cylinder heads, blocks, intake manifolds.

- Spare Parts	New OEM & Aftermarket Parts, Used OEM Parts, Performance Parts. Gaskets, water pumps, timing kits. Turbo components, intercoolers, exhausts. Sensors, ECUs, alternators, starters. Suspension, brakes, axles

- Body Parts: Exterior Panels & Trim, Glass & Mirrors, Lights & Electrical. Doors, hoods, fenders, bumpers. Headlights, taillights,  mirrors. Windshields, door glass

- Car Breaking: Part-Out Service, Core & Rebuildable Items	- Buying donor vehicles for inventory. Systematic dismantling and cataloging of all usable parts. Selling cores (engines/transmissions for rebuild).

- Vehicle Sales:Runner Vehicles, Non-Runner/Project Cars, Parts Cars. Inspected, road-ready Subarus.Non-runners for repair or restoration.  Parts cars sold as a whole to DIY enthusiasts.

- Garage Services: Mechanical Repair, Performance Work, Installation Services, Engine/transmission swaps. Maintenance, diagnostics, repairs. Installation of purchased parts (may affect warranty)

- Diagnostics & Inspection: Computer diagnostics, Pre-purchase inspections, General health checks, Leak & smoke testing.	Uses specialist Subaru software. Provides detailed reports. Essential for buying/selling cars and parts.

- Maintenance & Repair: Routine servicing (oil, filters, belts), Brake system service, Cooling system service, Exhaust repair, Electrical system repair.	Follows Subaru-specific schedules. Uses quality parts. Catches common Boxer engine issues early.

- Engine & Drivetrain: Engine rebuilds/overhauls, Engine swaps/installations, Turbocharger service, Head gasket replacement, Clutch & flywheel service, Differential & transmission service.	Core specialty. Handles complex jobs from simple timing belts to full performance builds.

- Performance & Tuning: Performance part installation, ECU tuning/remapping, Suspension upgrades (lowering, coilovers), Exhaust system installation, Cooling upgrades.	Turns repairs into upgrades. Partners with performance brands. Appeals to enthusiast market.

- Body & Assembly: Part-out/dismantling service, Parts installation (body panels, lights), Project car assembly/resurrection, Interior part installation.	Directly supports parts business. Helps customers build or restore their vehicles.

- Buying, Selling & Consultation: Vehicle purchase appraisal, "Sell us your Subaru" service, Parts sourcing service, Technical consultation/advice.	Generates core inventory (cars/parts). Builds community trust as the expert resource.

# Required Website Pages:
1. Homepage: Hero image with key services, clear value proposition ("Your Subaru Specialist"), quick-contact form, featured products/engines/cars
2. Services:  Detailed pages/anchors for each core service: Engine Sales & Swaps, Parts Department (New/OEM/Used), Car Breaking for Parts, Vehicle Buying & Selling, Specialist Garage & Repairs, Parts Catalog
3. Parts Catalog: A searchable/filterable list (even if manually updated) of available engines, cars for sale, and major parts. Each item with photos, description, and "Inquire" button (send automated message with product name to whatsapp).
4. About Us: Company profile, mission, vision.
5. Contact Page: Physical address, phone, email. Crucial: A prominent contact form for parts inquiries, service bookings, and car sales. Embedded Google Maps. Simple "What do you need?" dropdown (e.g., "Get a quote for a part," "Sell my car," "Book a service").

6. Lead-Generation Tactics on Site: Contact forms on every page. "Request a Quote" button on every product/service (send automated message with product name to whatsapp). "Get a Parts Finding Quote" dedicated form. "Sell Us Your Subaru" dedicated form with photo upload.
All leads and incoming messages from the website must go to the sales@rushsubaru.com.

# Required Modern Design and User Experience (UX)
- Clean, Minimalist Layout & White Space: A clutter-free design using ample white space prevents visitor overwhelm, guides the eye toward the CTA, and makes the content easy to scan.
- Mobile Responsiveness and Fast Loading Speed: A "mobile-first" design approach is essential, ensuring the page functions flawlessly and loads quickly on smartphones and tablets. Slow load times can kill conversions.
- Intuitive Visual Hierarchy: Content should be structured logically using layout, color contrast, and varying font sizes to guide the user's attention from the headline to the supporting details and finally to the CTA.
- Interactive Elements: Micro-interactions, subtle animations, or embedded interactive tools can make the experience dynamic and increase engagement. 
- Intuitive Interfaces: prioritize clear navigation and recognizable icons to reduce the learning curve.
- Consistency: Uniform design patterns, such as color scheme consistent button styles and typography, enhance predictability and trust.
- Feedback Mechanisms: Features like progress indicators, error messages, and confirmation notifications keep users informed and engaged.
- Mobile Optimization: ensure responsive designs for seamless experiences across devices.
- Usability: the interface must be intuitive and well-organized, provide a clear information hierarchy, making communication seamless and easy to navigate.
- Efficiency: offers features like drag-and-drop file sharing, keyboard shortcuts enabling users to complete tasks quickly and efficiently.
- Onboarding: New users are guided through an interactive onboarding process, including product tours and in-app messaging/notifications, ensuring a smooth start.
